Sentencas: TiN-type coatings have the potential to be used as SOFC interconnect coatings because of their low resistance and high temperature stability.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: In this research, various (Ti,Al)N coatings were deposited on stainless steels by filtered-are method.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: ASR and XRD tests were conducted on these coatings, and SEM/EDAX analyses were conducted after ASR and XRD tests.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: SEM/EDAX analyses show that (Ti,Al)N remains stable at temperature up to 700 degrees C in a short period of time.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: It is also indicated that Al has beneficial effect on the stability of TiN-type coatings.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: At 900 degrees C, (Ti-30Al)N is fully oxidized and some of (Ti-50Al)N coating still remains as nitride.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: The analyses on cross-sectional samples show that these coatings are an effective barrier to the Cr migration.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: In summary, (Ti,Al)N coatings are good candidates for the SOFC interconnect applications at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: The future directions of this, research are to improve the stability of these coatings by alloy-doping and to develop multi-layer coatings.
Titulo: Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications
Developing TiAlN coatings for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications
